QUESTION 52) On air travel, passengers are asked to dismiss all devices whose operation involves the issuance or reception of electromagnetic waves. The procedure is used to eliminate radiation sources that may interfere with riders' radio communications with the control tower.
The ownership of the issued waves that justifies the procedure adopted is the fact that
A) Have opposite phases.
B) be both audible.
C) have reverse intensities.
D) be of the same breadth.
E) have nearby frequencies.
